snippet: The men, one from China and one from Iran, are accused of trying to smuggle in materials for enriching uranium into Iran.
abstract: Justice Department indicts Parviz Khaki of Iran and Zongcheng Yi of China with conspiring to violate the embargo against Iran by trying to smuggle restricted equipment and materials suitable for gas centrifuges for enriching uranium into Iran; case underscores tensions with Iran over its nuclear program while opening a window into a group accused of being a global smuggling network.
lead_paragraph: The men, one from China and one from Iran, are accused of trying to smuggle in materials for enriching uranium into Iran.

headline.seo: Two Men Charged With Violating Iran Embargo
headline.main: U.S. Charges Men in Plot to Violate Iran Embargo
headline.print_headline: U.S. Charges Men in Plot To Violate Iran Embargo
